text: Me and a friend (on iOS) gave Wire a go, but we encountered several issues. They did not receive any notifications when I sent messages. No ability to save drafts, edit pictures before sending, or create chat shortcuts like on Signal/Whatsapp. Overall, Wire is unreliable and lacks too many features to be a good messaging app right now. One thing I did appreciate was the conversation back up/restore option, which Telegram lacks for encrypted chats. Edit: notifications fixed after app reinstall.

Currently, dark mode copies your device's settings, so if your Android system is in dark mode, so will the Wire app. Can you tell us more about what went wrong at https://support.wire.com/hc/en-us/requests/new ?

We look forward to your feedback.

Thanks,
Wire Support
text: I hate the new version of the app so much but it's the only option I have for a messenger at this point. Currently having a hard time with the fact that there is no dark mode and you still haven't restored the ability to search for words in individual chats. Also there's a new bug where people are changing their user pictures but they won't show up in the app and are currently blank but I know a picture should be there since on the desktop the new picture appears.
Works well when first downloaded... but now, can't use at all as keeps showing 'waiting for network' when I'm connected to wifi6 and able to use other apps... disappointed...
Gif insertion has not worked in months. I honestly can't remember the last time it did.
Just came back after a while, and now all my messages I've sent are all jumbled letters, so I only have half a conversation history.
Notifications don't work
Most of the time the app doesn't work. It show no network although my internet connection is strong
Not receiving audio or video on either end. Not willing to go through the troubleshooting with the company. Uninstalling and finding a product that functions. Just make a product that works.
Definitely underrated. This app has great potential. Keep up the good work, guys!
Sound while calling is too quiet both on speaker onn and off.
The app doesn't work well

My biggest beef is that you can't get rid of conversations and contacts, you can only clear your messages with them. So my dead father is still on my chat list, and even if I block him, it still stays there. Idiocy. Other than that, I dislike too much about the app to list it all. The good news is a family member loves it for some weird reason, and as a result I have no choice to use it or not. You can't please everyone...

To fix Wire, try doing an uninstall then reinstall on your phone when Wire nuts up (message delivery & notifications) AND AFTER EVERY MAJOR ANDROID OS UPDATE, then go into "devices" in Wire and delete all the other copies of your phone. Major Andoid OS updates seem to mess with the security keys in Wire and it then thinks the phone is a different phone, so copies accumulate in "devices" like floor wax, which seems to confuse Wire. The reinstall will create a current device, it seems.
